intro: Uvifera alagoensis, commonly known as the Alagoas uvifera, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Its flowers are usually pink or red and bloom during the dry season. Uvifera alagoensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
